body_html:
I just tried it again in a different virtualenv installed from source (not pip package) with tf.version == 1.9.0 and I was able to reproduce the bug. My colleague was not able to reproduce the bug (on CPU) despite being on 16.04 with tf v1.10.1 latest pip package.

I also tried again in my environment with a different test case and got the same problem:

dtype:    tf.float32
arr:      [3. 2. 8. 6.]
inds:     [2 3 0]
tf_vals:  [3. 6. 8.]
np_vals:  [8. 6. 3.]
body_text:
I just tried it again in a different virtualenv installed from source (not pip package) with tf.version == 1.9.0 and I was able to reproduce the bug. My colleague was not able to reproduce the bug (on CPU) despite being on 16.04 with tf v1.10.1 latest pip package.
I also tried again in my environment with a different test case and got the same problem:
dtype:    tf.float32
arr:      [3. 2. 8. 6.]
inds:     [2 3 0]
tf_vals:  [3. 6. 8.]
np_vals:  [8. 6. 3.]
body:
I just tried it again in a different virtualenv installed from source (not pip package) with tf.__version__ == 1.9.0 and I was able to reproduce the bug. My colleague was not able to reproduce the bug (on CPU) despite being on 16.04 with tf v1.10.1 latest pip package.

I also tried again in my environment with a different test case and got the same problem:

```
dtype:    tf.float32
arr:      [3. 2. 8. 6.]
inds:     [2 3 0]
tf_vals:  [3. 6. 8.]
np_vals:  [8. 6. 3.]
```
